data.title: Asian Fusion on Steriods
data.text: The menu has been paired down a little but the food quality is as good as ever.. Please don't pass on this restaurant you will miss out on fine dining for sure.

data.title: Big portions and nicely cooked beef and chicken
data.text: Zang is worth a try if your in the area. It's a cute little older but clean looking place. My husband and I tried the Shanghai Chicken and the Sichuan Beef. We both liked the Shanghai Chicken and both of us didn't care for the Sichuan Beef because of the very sweet sauce. I like that you can choose mild or spicy. Portions are very large and in both our meals the meats were cooked nice and tender.

data.title: Great price for the price
data.text: You better coming hungry for the amount of food you get. Not only does this place have great food but you can take home some for the lunch the next day. The staff is very friendly and the food is awsome!

data.title: Best Hot and Sour Soup I've ever had.
data.text:
My wife and I had dinner on December 23rd at Zang Asian Bistro in Glendale, Arizona, and were surprised and pleased to find this excellent restaurant tucked away on a side street just around the corner from Murphy Park in downtown Glendale. First, the restaurant has a pleasant modern airy setting. It is open for lunch and dinner every day of the week  except Mondays. The host and staff were friendly and attentive and appeared to be sincerely interested in our opinion.
The menu is wide and varied offering selections from China, Japan, Korea, Thailand, Vietnam and other Asian countries. Zang also has a full liquor license.
We started out with what we thought would be a traditional hot and sour soup but turned out to be a delicious variant thereof. Rich, loaded with vegetables, tofu, chicken and shrimp, it had the requisite heat and was served family style. My wife ordered Panko Chicken and I had Hoisin Beef. Both were  outstanding, the Panko Chicken delicate and tender and the Hoisin Beef rich with flavor and the portions were generous. The entrees, of course came with the requisite large bowl of  rice. Three variants of tea are available: oolong, jasmine and black. 
As noted above we thoroughly enjoyed the food, service and setting and definitely plan a return visit (probably more than one).
